explanation: To decide whether the controlling expressions in MHD_create_response_from_buffer are invariant you must know (a) what the constants being compared are and (b) what actual values callers pass for the 'mode' parameter. 1) enum MHD_ResponseMemoryMode: needed to see the declared enumerators, their underlying values and whether the type/values are compile-time constants or have additional aliases. 2) MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_FREE: the exact definition (enum constant or macro) is required to know whether the comparison (MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_FREE == mode) uses an invariant constant and to interpret caller arguments. 3) MHD_RESPMEM_MUST_COPY: same reason for the second if comparison. 4) MHD_create_response_from_data: this function is a listed caller of MHD_create_response_from_buffer — its call site(s) must be inspected to see what value/expression it passes for the 'mode' argument. 5) ahc_echo: also calls MHD_create_response_from_buffer; its call sites must be inspected to determine whether it always passes a fixed value (which could make the controlling expressions invariant) or varies the mode. Together these symbols let the analyst determine whether the comparisons in the if statements are effectively invariant across all call sites (violating MISRA) or depend on non-constant runtime values (permitted).
